name: scholar_scrape_paper
description: Scrape detailed information from an academic paper page. Navigates to the paper URL and extracts title, authors, abstract, citation count, publication venue, and related metadata.

parameters.name: paper_url
parameters.description: URL of the paper page (e.g. 'https://arxiv.org/abs/2301.00001' or any academic paper URL)

steps.label: Wait for paper page to load

steps.code: const titleEl = document.querySelector('h1, .title, #title, [class*="paper-title"], [class*="article-title"], .citation_title, meta[name="citation_title"]'); let title = ''; if (titleEl) { if (titleEl.tagName === 'META') { title = titleEl.getAttribute('content') || ''; } else { title = titleEl.textContent.trim(); } } const authorEls = document.querySelectorAll('.authors a, .author, [class*="author"] a, meta[name="citation_author"], .gs_a a, [rel="author"], .contrib-group a, .author-name'); const authors = []; const seenAuthors = new Set(); authorEls.forEach(function(el) { const name = el.tagName === 'META' ? (el.getAttribute('content') || '') : el.textContent.trim(); if (name && !seenAuthors.has(name) && name.length < 100) { seenAuthors.add(name); authors.push(name); } }); const abstractEl = document.querySelector('.abstract, #abstract, [class*="abstract"], [id*="abstract"], blockquote.abstract, .abstractSection, meta[name="description"]'); let abstract = ''; if (abstractEl) { if (abstractEl.tagName === 'META') { abstract = abstractEl.getAttribute('content') || ''; } else { abstract = abstractEl.textContent.trim().replace(/^Abstract\s*/i, '').substring(0, 2000); } } const dateEl = document.querySelector('.date, [class*="pub-date"], [class*="publish-date"], meta[name="citation_publication_date"], meta[name="citation_date"], time, .dateline'); let pubDate = ''; if (dateEl) { pubDate = dateEl.tagName === 'META' ? (dateEl.getAttribute('content') || '') : dateEl.textContent.trim(); } const venueEl = document.querySelector('[class*="journal"], [class*="venue"], [class*="conference"], meta[name="citation_journal_title"], meta[name="citation_conference_title"]'); let venue = ''; if (venueEl) { venue = venueEl.tagName === 'META' ? (venueEl.getAttribute('content') || '') : venueEl.textContent.trim(); } const doiEl = document.querySelector('[class*="doi"] a, a[href*="doi.org"], meta[name="citation_doi"]'); let doi = ''; if (doiEl) { doi = doiEl.tagName === 'META' ? (doiEl.getAttribute('content') || '') : (doiEl.href || doiEl.textContent.trim()); } const pdfEl = document.querySelector('a[href*=".pdf"], a[href*="pdf"], .pdf-link, meta[name="citation_pdf_url"]'); let pdfUrl = ''; if (pdfEl) { pdfUrl = pdfEl.tagName === 'META' ? (pdfEl.getAttribute('content') || '') : (pdfEl.href || ''); } const keywordEls = document.querySelectorAll('[class*="keyword"] a, [class*="keyword"] span, [class*="tag"] a, meta[name="keywords"]'); const keywords = []; keywordEls.forEach(function(el) { const kw = el.tagName === 'META' ? (el.getAttribute('content') || '') : el.textContent.trim(); if (kw) keywords.push(kw); }); return { title: title, authors: authors.slice(0, 20), abstract: abstract, publication_date: pubDate, venue: venue, doi: doi, pdf_url: pdfUrl, keywords: keywords.slice(0, 15), url: window.location.href }
steps.name: paper_data
steps.label: Extract paper details
